line.en: Summer vacation has begun, and a few days have\npassed.

The dock that Asa and Yoru lent us has better
equipment than the school garage we used last
summer, so the efficiency of our work
skyrocketed.
Thanks to that, the work to fix up the glider is\ngoing well.
Yesterday, after finishing the lamination on the\nwings and waiting for the pitch to harden, there\nwas a bit of spare time.
So today...
We had all come for a swim!
'Oh, Oh... Um, are we really going to do this?'
'Sorry, Asa, but all new members of the Soaring\nClub have to do this, it's a kind of initiation.'
While I commented on how overly serious this was,\nAgeha and I carried Asa to the top of the cliff.
'Asa, don't let go of the life preserver! You'll\ndie!'
'Quaaack!'
Kotori and Hat, who had jumped in earlier, call\nfrom below.
'Hey! Yoru!'
'You can do it, Asa!'
Forsaken even by Yoru, Asa decides to do it and\ncloses her eyes.
An American would probably draw a cross on their\nchest and pray to God.
'Let's go, Asa!'
'One, two...'
'Jump!'
Boing.
'Heeyaaaaaaaa'
While emitting a scream of relief, Asa glides\nthrough the air.
After a few seconds,
Ssssplash!
The scream is swallowed up by the small spray of\nwater.
'Wow, she jumped pretty well!'
'Could be a new record.'
'Wow... Th, that was scary.'
'Good job, Asa! Now you're a Soaring Club member\nin name and reality!'
'Quack, quack!'
'...What is the meaning of this?'
'A test of bravery?'
'Well, it's like training to cultivate a sense of\nflying.'
'Will you jump too, Yoru?'
'I'll pass. I'm not in the Soaring Club, after\nall.'
After our already established custom of jumping\nfrom the cliff, we began bathing in the sea, or\nrather, the lake.
'I wish Amane could have come, too.'
'There's no helping that. She's an adult, so\nshe's busy with work. She was saying that like\nshe was bragging.'
'But at least it seemed like she wanted to come.\nShe can join us next time, right?'
'Right.' (huff)'
Kotori turns away in a huff.
'Um, Kotori...?'
'What?' (huff)'
'About all that huffing and puffing, I wish you'd\nstop doing that.'
'Leave me alone.' (huff)'
She's still angry about our having peeked at her\nreply to the love letter the other day.
Well, it's natural for her to be angry, but...
'Let's go, Ageha. Let's swim over there.'
'OK.'
'Ageha was peeking the other day, too!'
What's with the difference in treatment?
'Oh no! Someone's been turned down!'
'Aoi, you can play with us.'
'...Thank you. I'm moved to tears by your\nkindness.'
Kotori doesn't actually seem that angry, either.\nWhile she is huffing and puffing, she listens to\nwhat I have to say.
She helps with preparing dinner, and she doesn't\nfuss when I push her wheelchair on the way back\nfrom the secret base.
It's just that she acts like she was a moment\nago.
She'll take parts of my dinner and eat them\nwithout asking.
Or she'll loosen the caps on my bottles of cola\nin the fridge, letting all the carbonation out.\nThose kinds of things.
I don't know whether it's to be cute or spiteful.
There was no changing her attitude, so I decide\nto play beach volleyball with Asa and the others.
'Ready...!'
'OK!'
'Whoa!'
We toss the ball and volley it around near the\nshore, where the water is shallow.
'Ready, Yoru?'
'Nice toss, Sis!'
'Whoa!'
'Oh! Are you OK, Aoi?'
'Oh! It hit your face!'
'You hit it too hard, Yoru!'
Just what am I doing?
'Listen, Kotori.'
'About what?'
'Leave Aoi alone.'
'Who cares about him?'
'Asa and the others seem to be having fun!'
'So what?'
'Asa seems like she's into Aoi. If things keep\ngoing like this, maybe...'
'Are you really angry that he peeked the other\nday?'
'Ye, yes. Being angry about that is natural.'
'I was looking, too.'
'...I, it's fine for you to look. We're best\nfriends.'
'But it's different for Aoi?'
'N...No, it's not that.'
'I thought so.'
'All right already! Just leave me alone!'
'I'm going, Hat!'
'Quack!'
'That Kotori...'
For the whole morning, we played beach\nvolleyball, swam, and built sand castles.
When it hit lunchtime, we ate the lunch boxes we\nhad made together, and then, after getting full,\nwe relaxed for the afternoon.
'This feels good...'
'Quack...'
I stood on the sand next to Hat, enjoying the\nsun.
Since I'm so full, I'm a bit sleepy.
Suddenly a cold can is pressed against my cheek.\nI'm startled and nearly jump up.
'Thirsty?'
'...Thank you.'
I take the juice from Ageha, pull the tab, and\ndrink.
It feels like it permeates through my\nsweat-drenched body.
'What's up with her?'
'She's on the boat taking in some sun.'
'...Is she still mad?'
'Who knows? I can't tell just by looking at her.'
'I see.'
Ageha sat next to me.
'Can I have a sip?'
She takes the juice from my hand and drinks.
'...Yuck. It's like we're indirectly kissing. If\nKotori sees this, maybe she'll get upset again!'
'If you feel that way, don't take my drink.'
I take the can back from Ageha and, after\nhesitating for a bit, put it to my mouth.
'Look at that!'
Ahead of Ageha's line of vision was Kotori on a\nrubber boat that was rocking around.
I looked at her, and...
was startled.
Kotori's eyes were closed and she looked\ncomfortable.
She was lying down on the rubber boat and\nsunbathing.
'(Today, she seems a bit...)'
Her sparkling white skin, illuminated by the sun.
Her black hair, which was wet and even more\nbeautiful than usual.
Her proportions, which were so nicely balanced.

I never realized, since she's always wearing
clothes, but she has quite a pinched-in waist. In
a swimsuit, Kotori looks more mature than she
usually does.
When we swam here last year, I didn't feel\nespecially impressed... Could she have matured\nsince then?

In addition to having the cuteness of a girl and
her nicely proportioned form, which had a mature
air to it, even the way she contorted her face
because of the sunlight was attractive.
Looking directly at her, my face gets hot.
But I couldn't turn my eyes away.
'Looking at her like this... she's such a\nbeautiful woman, huh?'
'Yeah...'
Ageha looks sideways at me when I answer in a\ndaze.
'There's no way someone wouldn't fall for her if\nthey were living together with someone so cute.'
'...I know, right?'
Again, I answer in a daze.
'*click*'
She clicked her tongue at me.
And then she lets out a sigh.
'Why don't you hurry up and make up with her?\nJust watching this is getting irritating for me.'
'If I could, I'd do it right away.'
'Buying her ice cream... probably won't work,\nwill it? There has to be a way.'
Getting a bit enthusiastic, I lean over and make\neye contact with Hat.
'Hat, I have a favor to ask.'
'Quack?'
'I want you to go and see how Kotori is doing.'
'Quack, quack!'
As if he understood my words, Hat walked off down\nthe sandy beach, shaking his bottom.
He entered the water and swam toward the boat\nthat Kotori was stretched out on.
'(Good! Just like that!')'
Upon arriving at the boat, Hat climbed onto\nKotori's stomach.
'Quack, quack!'
'Ungh...'
Kotori groaned as if she were worried.
'(Hat did it!)'
'Quack, quack.'
Hat pecked Kotori's stomach with his bill, trying\nto awaken her.
'Ungh...'
However, Kotori's eyes were still closed, and she\nlooked comfortable.
'Quack...'
Being ignored, Hat got bored, and performing a\nyawn-like motion, he curled up on Kotori's\nstomach.
As she breathes, her stomach rises and falls, and\nHat along with it.
'(Somehow Kotori seems to be in a good mood.)'
If she were in a bad mood, she would have gotten\nHat off of her stomach right away.
After verifying Kotori's mood barometer, I slowly\nbegin to make my way toward the boat.
'Euuu, Eughhh...'
'Hat, you're heavy...'
Suddenly Kotori opened her eyes.
'Quack?'
'Don't I always tell you not to sit on my\nstomach?'
'Quack, quack!'
'Don't you 'Quack quack' me!'
'...Come on already. You're in the way. Get off.\nIf you don't, I'll put you on a diet starting\ntomorrow.'
'Quack, quack!'
Being spoken to by Kotori, maybe Hat thought they\nwere playing. He seemed to be in a good mood.
And inversely, Kotori's expression got sterner\nand sterner.
'Quack! ...Quack?'
Kotori grabbed Hat tightly.
Then she flung him toward the water.
'Quaaaaack...'
I was standing right where he fell into the\nwater.
My eyes met Kotori's.
'...What do you want?'
'Um, well...'
I had been making a plan in my head about how to\napproach her, but it all went to waste.
'You look comfortable.'
'Do you want to use this boat?'
'No, it's not that.'
My gaze wandered while I searched for words.
Up to Kotori, who was stretched out on the rubber\nboat...
'...(blushes)'
'No, it's... I'm not looking.'
'...You pervert!'
Saying those words lazily, Kotori turned her head\nto face the opposite side.
'Pervert...'
Somehow it seemed that my plan had ended in\nfailure.
'Welcome back. How did it go?'
'Not well at all...'
Not only had my plan failed, I'd been called a\npervert.
'Aww, that's too bad.'
'I'm going to go cool off in the shade.'
I went to a cool area in order to think of my\nnext strategy.
'...I wonder what he was doing just now.'
'It seemed like he had been looking at me the\nwhole time, but...'
'Hey, Hat.'
'Quack, quack!'
'...No, it's fine. Hat, you're heavy. Get off\nme.'
'Guys, you didn't forget anything, did you?'
'Did you gather up all of your trash?'
'OK! Let's go home!'
I gave everyone instructions like a teacher in\ncharge, and then pushed Kotori's wheelchair.
It's heavy on the sand, so much that only a man\ncan push it.
'Oh... My butt is all sandy!'
'I'll wash it off for you when we get back.'
'Oh, thanks... Ah! (turns away)'
'...You don't have to act like you just\nremembered.'
'I don't like what I don't like!'
It felt like she was just continuing to be\nspiteful.
I wondered if she'd ever lighten up, and I\nstarted to feel uneasy.
But if that's not the case...
'(Kotori is so cute when she's sulking!)'
It was a strange feeling, but it had been a fun\nday.
'(I was able to see Kotori in her swimsuit, after\nall!)'
'What is it?'
'Pervert. (turns away)'
'(...I wonder if my expression gave it away.)'
I tightened up my facial expression and headed\nhome.
'Just forgive him already.'
'Why should I?'
'Because it's making everyone feel weird.'
'I mean, you're not really angry anymore, are\nyou? You just don't know when to make up with him\nbecause you're too busy sulking, right?'
'Wha... That's not it at all. My heart is going\nwild, like a bear that just woke up after\nhibernating.'
'Liar. During the day, when Aoi went and talked\nto you, you were so happy that you were\nblushing.'
'N, no I wasn't! I didn't blush!'
'...Was my face that red?'
'Aoi is nice and forgiving, so you're OK, but\nmost people would be fed up with you by now.'
'Guh... You think so? I wonder if Aoi will start\nto hate me.'
'He might...!'
'Ohhh...'
'You're into Aoi, aren't you?'
'...I don't know about that.'
'Why? You don't know your own feelings?'
'I mean, I hadn't thought about that kind of\nthing until now.'
'Even living together for a whole year?'
'I was sooo happy when I got that love letter\nfrom Miyada.'
'Really? But I thought you didn't even know who\nhe was.'
'...You're right. I hadn't even seen his face.\nBut I was happy.'
'I mean, he said he was into me!'
'I'm... like this now, so being the object of\nsomeone's affection? I never thought it'd\nhappen.'
'So I was surprised when I got the love letter,\nand I was really... happy.'
'Kotori...'
'He was someone who saw me as a lady. I didn't\nthink anyone would ever do that.'
'So you were trying not to fall for anyone?'
'But there was someone...'
'Of course there was. I mean, you're so cute,\nKotori!'
'But I'm like this... And my personality... ...is\ntwisted.'
'C'mon, it's not twisted. You're a little weird,\nbut it's cute.'
'...Aoi likes you, right, Ageha?'
'Huh? Why do you say that?'
'You said he confessed his feelings for you...'
'Oh, c'mon! That was a long time ago. It was when\nwe were both young!'
'Plus, the important thing is how you feel,\nright? Who do you like, Kotori?'
'...This love letter? I'm still reading it every\nday.'
'While thinking, 'If only I'd gotten it from\nAoi.'
'Kotori...'
'You know, you could always tell him how you\nfeel, too.'
'N, n, no way! I can't do that!'
'I'm sure my affection would just be a bother to\nhim.'
'Little old me... I'd just be a burden on him.'
'Oh, Kotori! Do you really think Aoi is the kind\nof guy who would think that sort of thing?'
'...(shakes head)'
'But I can't tell him. I just can't.'
'...If he turned me down, I would never recover.\nI'd rather just be close friends with him\nforever.'
'...Well, I guess I can understand your\nfeelings.'
'Good morning!'
'Good morning, Ageha. Where is Kotori?'
'She's still asleep. She was up late yesterday,\nafter all.'
Yesterday, after swimming in the lake, Ageha had\nspent the night in Kotori's room.
They were excited about having a pajama party,\nand I heard their voices all night.
'It's raining, huh?'
'Yeah. It's supposed to continue for a while.'
Ageha takes some milk from the fridge and pours\nit into a cup.
'(gulp gulp gulp)... Ahhh! She doesn't seem angry\nanymore.'
'I mean, it seemed like you wanted to ask.'
'Oh. Well I'm glad.'
'Aoi, you have feelings for Kotori, right?'
She said it so frankly that it took me a moment\nto process the question.
'...Yeah, I do.'
I answered so unhappily partly because I was\nbashful, and partly because it was frustrating to\nbe asked so plainly, like it was nothing.
'Why don't you tell her you like her?'
'It's not that easy.'
'We have the Soaring Club, I'm in charge of the\ndorms, and... there are her feelings, too.'
'You already have an idea of her feelings,\nthough, right?'
Ageha said this while drinking her milk.
'I have no idea.'
About all I know is that she doesn't hate me.
Even if she says she likes me, it can mean many\ndifferent things.
'Besides... if I said something and it didn't\nwork out, I might make her feel cornered.'
'Cornered??'
'She relies on me, right? But when I think about\nthings getting awkward...'
'Hmmm.'
Ageha sounded like she was in a bad mood.
'Well, aren't you full of yourself? Kotori would\nbe fine without you.'
'She'd get along splendidly. If she needed\nsupport, I'd be there. And to add to that...'
'Well to me, what you're saying just makes it\nsound like pride.'
'Why pride?'
'Like... You're so glad that Kotori depends on\nyou.'
'You're wrong.'
'Whatever. It isn't for me to say. Go ahead and\ndo as you like.'
What a thing to say.
'Yeah, I'll do what I want.'
In any case, nothing will come from continuing on\nlike this.
I have to do something about this feeling, and\nfast.
'Excuse meee!'
'Oh, hey, Hibari.'
'Hello, Aoi.'
Hibari had come in the rain, just after noon.
Before, Hibari had come once a week, but lately\nshe had been coming less. It was her first visit\nsince summer break had started.
'I haven't seen you in a while.'

'Yeah, I've been busy with work. On top of that,
lately it seems like Kotori's been enjoying
herself, so I've been able to relax and just
watch.'
'...I'd actually like to come every day, but.'
Her voice had an unhappy tone. Knowing her, she\nmay actually come every day.
'But it's rare for you to come at this time.'
She usually comes at night.
'I came today because I have something important\nto discuss with Kotori.'
Hibari took on a serious facial expression and\nspoke firmly.
'I don't want to!'
'Please, Kotori!'
'If I say I don't want to, I don't want to! There\nis NO WAY I'm going home!!'
'Please, just during Obon. Mom and Dad both want\nto see you.'
'I went home for the New Year. Isn't that\nenough?'
'That was on a day trip. You were only home for a\nlittle bit!'
'That was as much as I could handle.'
'...Are you still bothered by that?'
'It's in the past. Both of them feel bad, OK?'
'It's not in the past. Not at all. To me, it\nfeels like it was yesterday.'
'Kotori...'
'Got it? Now leave.'
'No, I won't leave! Today, no matter what\nhappens, I will get you to promise to go home!'
'Buh... No matter how much you insist, There is\nNO WAY I'm going home!'
'Do you just intend to stay like that?'
'Yes, I do.'
'OK, so what will you do after you graduate from\nschool? Will you live alone?'
'Kotori, don't run away from this... I understand\nthat it's difficult, but.'
'Hat.'
'Quack?'
'Attack!'
'Huh?'
'Quack, quack!'
'Ugh, ugh! Hat, cut it out!'
'Quack, quack Quaaaack!!'
'Aaaa!'
'Quaaaack!'
'C'mon! Forgive me!'
Driven away by Hat, Hibari ran from Kotori's\nroom.
'Whoa! Cut it out, Hat!'
'Quack, quack!'
'Are you OK, Hibari?'
'(Panting) ...I'm fine.'
'(Sticks out her tongue)'
After getting Hat back, Kotori shut the door and\nlocked it.
'...What's with her?'
'It's fine. I went too far.'
'What on earth happened just now? ...It seemed\nlike you were fighting over whether she'd go\nhome.'
I asked while preparing tea.
'This year, I'm going to take Kotori home. I've\nmade up my mind.'
'...What do you mean by 'take her home'?'
'Um, only during Obon! I don't mean she'll stay\nhome forever.'
Hearing that, I give a sigh of relief.
'But I failed...'
'Why won't she go home? Are things not going well\nwith her family?'
I felt it might be a rude question, but I'd been\nwondering, so I went ahead and asked.
With a grave look on her face, Hibari stared at\nthe glass of barley tea, on which droplets of\nwater had collected.
'...Have you heard anything about how Kotori hurt\nher legs?'
'Yeah, just a little. If I remember correctly, it\nwas something about an accident during a family\ntrip.'
'That was four years ago. Because of the\naccident, our joyful family trip took a terrible\nturn...'

'Until then, we were the model of a happy family.
My parents got along, I had a cute little sister
like Kotori... We were an ordinary, happy family
that anyone would be jealous of.'
'But that accident changed everything.'
You never know what will happen in life.
There are times when you think you're living an\nordinary life, and then suddenly, without\nwarning, something is taken from you.
Just like what happened with me.
But what my situation couldn't compare to what\nwas taken from the Habane family.
'I always thought it was strange, but why is\nKotori living in a dorm?'
'Usually, if someone has a handicap, don't they\nlive with their family?'
Otherwise, they might enter a facility with a\ncaregiver.
'After Kotori got into the accident, our family\nchanged drastically.'
'Our parents blamed each other, and, seeing\nKotori's immobile legs, they cried every day.'
'Kotori was a volleyball player, you know. She\nwasn't very tall, but could jump so high. She was\nso cool...'
'I think that made it especially hard.'
'...But that's terrible. It's harder for Kotori\nthan anyone else.'
'Yeah...' Hibari said, nodding deeply.
'Both Mom and Dad love Kotori from the bottom of\ntheir hearts.'
'That's why they tried not to show how sad they\nwere in front of her.'
'But even if you try to hide that kind of thing,\nit shows through. I mean, we're family.'
'Kotori thought it was her fault, and in no time,\nshe started to blame herself.'
'So because of that, Kotori is...'
Hibari nodded.
'I think she couldn't stand being there anymore,\nso she left.'
'Since Kotori left, it's been like time has\nstopped.'
'Just like the... accident around that time.'
Since I wasn't there, I can only imagine it.
If I lost Kotori now...
I would be tortured by suffering. It would feel\nlike being torn apart.
But it was the hardest on Kotori.
I'm positive that her mom and dad both understood\nthat and were trying their best to be\nconsiderate.
But even so, it's not possible to bury all of\nthat sadness and continue smiling.
I'm sure that sadness is too much for one person\nto bear.
Unbelievably so.
'I'm glad that Kotori came to Flying Fish Manor.'
'She particularly changed after meeting you,\nAoi.'
'She began smiling, she made more friends, and\nshe seems to be having fun every day.'
'It's almost like she's returning to the old\nKotori, little by little.'
'If that's the case... it makes me happy, too.'
If I could ease the sadness of Kotori and her\nfamily, even by just a little bit, I would do\nanything.
'If my mom and dad saw Kotori now, they'd feel so\nrelieved and be able to laugh again, like old\ntimes.'
'When she went home for the New Year, they seemed\nso happy. The house felt so much lighter for the\nfirst time in ages.'
Seeing Hibari's sweet smile at saying this, I\nfelt a pain, like my chest was being squeezed.
'Hey! Kotori!'
There was no reply.
'Kotori, I know you're there! Open the door\nalready!'
I heard the sound of the door being unlocked.
'I'm going in!'
'...Were you asked to come by Hibari?'
'No. Look, what you did earlier was terrible.'
'Pft, I just scared her a bit. Right, Hat?'
'Quack, quack!'
Well, I guess Hat had just rustled about and\ndriven Hibari off; he hadn't even pecked at her.
But even then, a weak girl may even faint if\nattacked by a huge bird like this.
'You did well a moment ago, Hat. You're my\nbodyguard.'
'Quack!'
Hat seemed happy to be praised by Kotori.
I took out a cucumber I had been hiding and waved\nit in front of Hat.
'Stay calm for a little bit, OK?'
'Quaaaack!'
'Wh, what are you doing?'
'I can't have Hat set on anyone else, so...'
'No! Don't eat that, Hat!'
'(munch munch)'
Hat is fully concentrating on eating cucumbers,\nhis favorite food, and doesn't seem to hear his\npartner's voice.
'Guh...I guess he is a duck, after all.'
'So why won't you go home?'
'I told you before, didn't I? Because right now\nis a difficult time for me.'
'I'll be fine if you aren't here during Obon.'
'...What are you talking about? Are you saying\nyou don't care whether I'm here or not?'
'Just during Obon!'
It was clear that Kotori was upset.
'I heard about the situation from Hibari. I think\nI understand... your pain.'
'But running away won't solve anything, will it?'
'I'm NOT running away!'
'You don't hate your mom and dad, do you?'
'I mean, when you were talking about quitting\nschool before, you said you wanted to reassure\nyour dad.'
Kotori remained in sullen silence.
'You're actually worried about your family,\nright?'
'...I mean, a little bit, but.'
'Then it wouldn't hurt to go back for just a bit,\nwould it?'
'During Obon, while you aren't here, the others\nand I can cover for you. So...'
'I SAID I'm not going home. Just leave me alone!'
'Kotori--'
'Why do you have to say things like that? I don't\nwant to hear anything about it from you, Aoi!'
'This matter involves only my family. It has\nnothing to do with you, so don't butt in!'
Hearing Kotori's teary yelling, Hat, who had been\neating the cucumber, reflexively lifted his head.
'...I'm sorry. I went too far.'
'Um, Aoi...'
'You're completely right. ...This is not\nsomething I should butt into.'
I forced a smile when I said it, but I might have\nfelt a bit lonely.
'...That's right. It doesn't involve you.'
'...I'm sorry. Anyone would have gotten angry.'
'I'm sorry I tried to meddle in your business.'
After saying that, I left Kotori's room.
The rain continued to drizzle for several days,\nas though it were clinging on.
After that, things somehow got awkward between\nKotori and me, and we stopped talking\nface-to-face.
It wasn't that we were angry or hated each other.
We just didn't know how to interact.
'This is such an unpleasant atmosphere...'
'Those two have been like this for awhile now.'
'Hmm... Our efficiency has gone up from working\nsilently, though.'
'But Asa's about to suffocate!'
'It...It's hard to breathe! I can't take it!'
'I know what you mean.'
'But there's not much we can do...'
'How have things been since then? Has Aoi talked\nto you?'
'...Not since last night at dinner, when I was\nasked about putting mayonnaise on the\nokonomiyaki.'
'It's pretty serious, then...'
'I never thought Aoi would get so depressed.'
'...What can I do? I wonder if he hates me.'
'Hm. I really couldn't say.'
'I don't like this... I don't want Aoi to hate\nme.'
'I guess it may have been that one thing you\nsaid.'
...I don't want to hear anything about it from\nyou, Aoi!
'He was acting like he was your guardian. Weren't\nyou shocked?'
'I, I...It just came out of my mouth. It's not\nreally how I feel.'
'So why not tell him that? I think things would\ngo back to normal.'
'Hmm... I wonder about that.'
'And what was it that Aoi said after that?'
'He apologized for meddling.'
'Well, it's strange for him to butt in about\nother people's family affairs.'
'I don't think so! For Aoi... it's OK.'
'If that's what you think, then tell him how you\nfeel! Being all gloomy won't change anything!'
'But he already hates me. I know it! He'll think,\nlike, 'What are you doing telling me now?''
'Gosh, I'm soaked!'
'Amane!'
'Oh, Amane!'
'Hey guys. Do you have anything I could wipe\nmyself off with?'
'Make up with Kotori!'
'Before my sister asphyxiates!'
'It's not that easy...'
I was being pressed by the Kazato sisters at the\nend of the dock.
'Sorry I made things so awkward. But... Umm...'
They were telling me to make up with Kotori, but\nit wasn't like we were fighting. What could I do?
'Well I don't like it! I want you and Kotori to\nget along!'
'It just feels uncomfortable, like when you\nfasten a button in the wrong place.'
'You should get along like before. Come on, Aoi!'
Asa grabs my arm and shakes it like she's\npleading.
Kotori and I had gotten along well.
Almost too well.
That's why I'd intruded on her family's business\nso bluntly, like I knew everything.
I really hurt her.
For instance, the time I tried to stop Kotori\nfrom quitting school, I didn't hold anything\nback.
I thought she'd hate me for it, to be honest.
I felt that even if she hated me for it, if new\npossibilities occurred to her, it would be worth\nit.
I was able to do that because we'd just met.
But the issue recently was different.
I'd gotten comfortable with our friendship and\nintruded into an area she was uncomfortable with.
...I don't want to hear anything about it from\nyou, Aoi!
'(Honestly, that was a shock to hear...)'
Remembering that makes my heart sink, even now.
Thanks to that, I wasn't sure how to talk to\nher--I felt a vague sense of distance.
Of course I don't want to leave things like this.
'When Kotori calms down a bit, I'll apologize to\nher again.'
There was something else I had to tell her.
'Promise me.'
'OK, I promise.'
The problem is that I know Kotori isn't asking\nfor an apology.
So what should I do...
The door opened, and Ageha and the others\nreturned to the dock.
From the back,
'Hey!'
'Amane!'
'Long time no see, Aoi!'
Amane entered in her usual carefree fashion.
It was the first time in a while that she'd come\nhere.
'Whoa, you've gotten quite a bit done!'
She says this looking at the airframe, which has\ndrawn close to completion.
'All we have to do are the paint job and the\ndetails.'
'That's good. Seems like you have plenty of time\nto do it schedule-wise, too.'
'Everyone, gather round!'
Saying things with deep meaning, Amane gathered\neveryone.
Kotori noticed me and awkwardly averted her\nglance.
Amane began talking, not noticing the strange\natmosphere.
'I'm so sorry that I rarely come here, despite\nbeing the advisor.'
'It's because I'm an adult. I'm busy.'
'Not at all! It's enough for you to be the\nadvisor!'
Ageha ignores the bragging about being an adult\nand replies.
'So I wanted to be of some help. I made this...'
Amane begins to remove a large sheet of paper\nfrom a long, thin tube.
'Oh, it's wet! Guh... water seeped in through the\ncracks!'
'What is that?'
Ageha asked, feeling rushed by the somehow\npitiful atmosphere.
'This is... Umm... a present for Kotori.'
'For me?'
Kotori is dazed, taken by surprise.
'I found a bookmark... on the office PC...\nand...'
'I drew this up.'
Saying that, she opened the sheet. It looked like\nsome kind of blueprint.
But it was not a glider.
For a moment, even Ageha didn't know what it was.
'What is this? It looks like... a cockpit.'
'Right, wasn't that on the PC? A foreign-made\ncockpit...'
Everyone is surprised by my sudden outburst.
'Gosh! You scared me!'
'...What happened?'
'This is a cockpit for handicapped people!!'
Kotori, who had raised her head after hearing my\noutburst, peered at the blueprint again.
'The thing you looked at, Amane, was it that\nGerman glider production site? The one that Aoi\nfound a while ago...'
'Yes. If you try to import it, it'll be\ndifficult, right?'
'So I thought we could make it ourselves.'
'We should have done this from the beginning.'
'Um... I don't really understand what you mean.'
'This is for you.'
'If you have this, you can fly!'
I cut off Amane, turned to Kotori, and spoke\nenthusiastically.
'You can fly the glider with your own hands!'
How about it? Aren't you thrilled?
'Oh, OK.'
Kotori had a blank look on her face.
Seeing her expression, I remembered that we\nhadn't been talking for several days.
Then I realized I had gotten a little too happy,\nand felt embarrassed.
But the happiness that bubbled up after that\ncould not be controlled.
'Kotori, you should be excited! This means you\ncan fly by yourself!'
'Um, really...?'
Kotori still didn't seem to understand. She was\nvacantly staring at the blueprint.
'It makes it possible to control the rudder not\nwith pedals, but with your hands. We'll have to\nalter the cockpit, but...'
'It shouldn't be hard to do that.'
'...Aoi, you found this for me'
'Um, yeah... I thought you probably want to fly\nby yourself, so...'
But I never thought that Amane would draw up a\nblueprint.
For a while, Kotori stared in amazement not at\nthe blueprint, but at me.
'...Thank you, Amane.'
'Yep.'
Suddenly, Kotori reversed the wheelchair.
'Oh! Kotori!'
'I'm... going to use the restroom.'
Saying that, she left the dock.
'She didn't seem that happy.'
'...I wonder if doing this was intruding, too.'
'Um, I don't really think so.'
'...He doesn't...'
'...He doesn't hate me...'
'Just for me... Aoi found...'
'(sniff)...(sniff)'
'I'm so glad... So glad...'
The next day, the rain, which had stretched over\nseveral days, stopped.
'Hehehe...'
'Whoa...'
The improved airframe was finally completed!
Standing before this object they'd put their\nblood, sweat, and tears into, everyone was filled\nwith emotion.
'We did it, Kotori!'
'Yep... We did it.'
Standing a bit away from me, Kotori's eyes were\nshining with just a bit of happiness.
Seeing that, Ageha winked and smiled at me\nsecretly.
I nod back at her.
There is still a bit of distance from Kotori.
However, the awkwardness from before is gone.
It seemed we were both waiting for a good time to\nmake up.
'Come on! We don't have time to stare blankly!\nTake apart the airframe and put it in the\ntrailer!'
'OK!'
'All right.'
'I'll help, too.'
We take apart the assembled airframe and load it\nonto the trailer.
Today we will go to the runway and do a test.
A test with our new model glider!
'Asa, be careful. Don't bump into anything!'
'O, OK.'
Today was Asa's first time to do assembly work on\nthe glider's body.
It's not difficult work, but mistakes can lead to\nlarge accidents.

When people involved with gliders do assembly
work like this by themselves, they begin to
understand the composition and functions of the
airframe.
'It's finally finished, huh?'
An-chan says this while gazing at the improved\nglider being assembled.
I had gotten him to help with transporting the\nglider.
I would imagine An-chan feels connected to this\nglider, too.
'To be honest, I didn't think you guys could pull\nthis off so well.'
'It's thanks to your help, An-chan.'
He provided us with cheap materials, searched for\ndifficult-to-find parts, and sometimes helped\nwith building.
'I wanted to see this thing fly, too.'
'Are you going to fly it today, Aoi?'
'Yeah.'
It's my first time flying here in a while.
Until today, I had been using my weekends and\ndoing training at runways a distance away.
I'm different than I was a year ago.
'Amane isn't here, is she?'
'She says she's busy because she's an adult. Even\nif she isn't here today, she'll have plenty of\nchances to see a test flight.'
'Aoi, man the cockpit. I'm going to do a positive\ncontrol check.'
'All right!'
I get into the cockpit and check the piloting\nsystem.
The tail assembly and wings have been remade, so\nit feels different from before.
'OK. Next are the rear seats.'
We carefully undertake various types of checks.
Of course Asa and the other newbies were nervous,\nbut so were Ageha, Kotori, and I.
It is our first test flight in a long time.
'All right, now to check the division of roles.'
'First, Aoi is the pilot. Next, I will control\nthe winch...'
'Huh? I thought I would.'
'No, I'll do it. Asa will hold the wing tip and\nrun.'
'OK! I'll do my best!'
'Yoru, please check the safety of the surrounding\narea.'
'Understood.'
'...What about me?'
Kotori asked with insecurity in her voice.\nWithout a word, Ageha winked at me.
'Your seat is over there, isn't it?'
I motioned to the rear seat with my thumb.
Kotori looked around at everyone's faces.
Until coming here, Kotori had been assigned to\nthe position of controlling the winch.
However, no one is surprised by the sudden\nchange.
That's because there had been a meeting\nbeforehand with everyone except Kotori.
Kotori also realized that when she saw everyone's\nunnatural expressions.
'I made you a promise, right? I'll let you ride\nfirst.'
'I made you wait quite a while, but...'
Kotori had been looking at me vacantly as I\nblushed, but soon she blushed even more.
'...That's not right... I mean, Ageha worked\nharder than anyone to build it.'
'But me? I wasn't that much help...'
'That's not true!' ...Is what you want to hear,\nright? Quit acting like a kid.'
'Ah... Asa, you want to ride too, right?'
'I do want to try riding it. But it's normal for\nolder people to get first priority, right?'
'How about you, Yoru...'
'I'm not even in the club; I just helped.'
'It's not like we're only going to fly once.'
'That's right. I want you to ride first, Kotori.'
'You're the club president, aren't you? So it's\nfine, right?'
'...Yeah.'
Kotori glanced upwards at me nervously.
As there has been some awkwardness between us for\nthe past several days, I can't expect her to\nsuddenly be happy.
'I'll ride.'
'OK.'
'Asa and Yoru, help me get Kotori into the rear\nseat.'
'All right.'
'OK.'
Kotori was lifted by the others and put into the\nrear seat of the glider.
'Is the seatbelt loose?'
'It's fine.'
'Don't touch the control stick.'
I spoke to Kotori as I got into the front seat.
'O, OK.'
'Aoi, this is our first flight with the new\nmodel. Don't take any chances with your flying.'
'Of course I won't. Close the canopy.'
'All right. Kotori, have a good flight.'
The canopy was closed.
Outside sound was blocked out by the clear dome.
I felt a sense of nervousness coming from the\nrear seat.
Outside, Ageha was running toward the winch.
Yoru is inspecting the surrounding conditions\nfrom a distance away, and Asa is checking the\ntowline.
Finally, it's time for the improved glider's\nfirst flight.
The wings we all made together will fly through\nthe air.
And the promise I made with Kotori a year ago\nwill be fulfilled.
'The air current is calm today. We won't be able\nto fly very high, but this is perfect for our\nfirst flight.'
'But if you get scared, tell me. I'll land right\naway.'
'OK.'
'Aoi, are you ready?'
I heard Ageha's voice through the radio.
'Are you all right, Kotori?'
'I'm fine.'
'We're OK.'
I answered Ageha and gave the signal to Asa.
Asa walked around to the side of the body and\nlifted the wing, which had been leaning on the\nground.
'R, runway is clear!'
The runway had been checked.
'Lift us up!'
'Roger! Let's go!'
Whoosh! The towline was pulled, and the glider\nbegan to move.
It accelerated suddenly.
Asa was running with all her might, but soon let\ngo of the wing.
I pull the control stick.
The glider, which had been running over the\nweed-covered, bumpy ground, gently lifted up.
'W...we're off the ground.'
While the glider floated near the ground, it was\npulled by the winch and picked up more speed.
'I'm going higher!'
'OK!'
I pulled the control stick back and aimed the\nnose upward.
The airframe suddenly began to gain altitude.
Feeling the Gs with my whole body, I grip the\ncontrol stick so the glider wouldn't lose\ncontrol.
As we got further from the ground, and the sky\nspread out before us outside the canopy.
'I'm going to disconnect!'
As we got directly above the winch, I pulled the\nrelease lever.
The hook was disconnected and the towline was\nreleased from the underside of the airframe.
We were released from the force that had been\npulling us back, and the glider was thrown into\nthe sky.
I quickly turned and checked the towline's\ndisconnection.
'I have confirmed the release.'
'Roger.'
'The parachute is coming down... This is how it\nlooks from above.'
Kotori, who had always been in charge of the\nwinch, was looking at the small parachute from\nbelow.
'Takeoff successful.'
As I announced this, Kotori looked at the outside\nview from the rear seat.
'Wow... It's really flying.'
'Are you scared?'
'No, not at all!'
I'm facing forward, so I can't see, but I am sure\nthat Kotori's round eyes are sparkling.
That's what her voice sounded like.
To check the feel of the new wings, I first flew\nslowly over the runway.
'It responds to the rudder more quickly than the\nold wings.'
'But the feeling of gliding is smooth.'
As this is a test flight, I have to remember how\nit feels and report it to Ageha later.
'Asa and the others look so small! They won't\neven know if I wave to them...'
'Aoi, how does it feel?'
'Right now, it has a good feel. It's more\nsensitive than the old glider, but the gliding\nitself is smooth.'
'How are you, Kotori?'
'I feel great!'
'Good. All right, do your best.'
'O, OK.'
What does she have to do her best at?
'I have a grasp of the feel, so I'll stretch out\nmy legs a bit.'
'Roger. Just be careful.'
'Shall we go back to that place?'
'That place...?'
'Windmill Hill.'
'Yeah!'
Kotori seemed to think it was a good idea.
I tilted the control stick to the side, stepped\non the rudder pedal, and flew the glider toward\nthe lake.
'Whoa... It's really flying...'
'How is it, Asa? You're watching as the wings you\nbuilt are now flying through the sky.'
'It feels strange. How can it fly like that?'
'It is strange. It's gliding while balancing\nitself in the air.'
'...Looks like they're going somewhere. Maybe\nover to the lake?'
'That's our standard course for test flights.'
The glider crossed over the lake and drew near\nthe area above Windmill Hill.
'The view is great... I didn't know the lake was\nso big.'
We were at the edge of the north side of the\nlake.
The lake is long and thin vertically. This\nportion of it in particular is narrow, almost\nlike a river.
Thanks to that, crossing over it in a glider is\nsimple.
I slowly flew the glider over the peak of\nWindmill Hill.
There was a bit of a warm air current.
'I like the view here most of all.'
'Yeah, it's nice. The windmills standing in a row\nare so pretty... You can see the town, too.\n...Oh! Is that our secret base?'
I saw the dock's round roof in the area that\nKotori was looking.
It's a rather large building, but looks small\nfrom here.
'Do you remember it? The day that we first met.'
'...Yes, of course I do.'
'Right over in that area, your wheelchair had\ngotten a flat tire.'
'You came and fixed it for me...'
'And then the glider that Amane was piloting came\nflying in...'
'Yeah.'
Had even one of these coincidences not happened,\nwe may not have been enjoying this time together\nin the sky.
'...This is how it looks from above.'
Kotori spoke with emotion as she looked down\nthrough the canopy.
I flew around the area slowly, just as Amane had\ndone at that time.
'Um...Aoi?'
Kotori called my name nervously from the back.
'Hm?'
'...Thank you.'
'About the cockpit...'
She was talking about the blueprint that Amane\nhad drawn for us.
'But I didn't do anything.'
I just learned that there were cockpits for\npeople with handicaps and collected information.
Amane had found it by chance and drawn a\nblueprint for us.
'It's not like I asked for it. If you want to\nthank someone, tell Amane...'
'E, even though it was for me...You were so\nhappy, like the blueprint was for you.'
'...I was really happy.'
'Oh... Yeah.'
I felt a little embarrassed to be told that.
At the time, I hadn't dreamed that Amane would\nprepare something like that for us, so in my\nsurprise, I got too excited.
I had gotten too happy, so Kotori, who should\nhave been happy, felt confused.
'And what's more, you searched for that cockpit\nfor me, right?'
'I just found it on the net by chance and\nthought, 'If we had this, Kotori could fly by\nherself.'
'...Thank you.'
'I didn't do anything to warrant being thanked.'
Being thanked even though I didn't do anything\nspecial actually made me feel weird.
'...But I'm glad that Amane drew that blueprint.\nWhen we finish building the cockpit, you can fly,\ntoo.'
'Yeah.'
'You'll have to train really hard, you know!'
I jokingly spoke in a threatening manner, but\nKotori nodded solemnly from the rear seat.
'A, and...'
Kotori hesitates, as though it's hard to say.
'...About what happened the other day.'
I heard the sound of her inhaling, as though she\nwere taking a deep breath.
'I'm sorry I said that terrible thing.'
'Oh... it's OK.'
I don't want to hear anything about it from you,\nAoi!
'I was wrong... You always think of what's best\nfor me, and...'
'I feel like I said something that went against\nthat, so...so...'
Her voice made it sound like she was about to\ncry.
I couldn't bear it, so I began to speak.
'No, I'm sorry I intruded on your personal\nmatters...'
'You didn't!'
Kotori reflexively cut me off.
'I want you to say more things like that!'
'It's not weird for you to to say things like\nthat...'
'Kotori...'
'I, I'm stupid and stubborn... and don't say how\nI feel... so sometimes I take on that kind of\nattitude, but...'
'But that's not how I really feel!'
'I want you to...to know that.'
'OK. I'll remember.'
I could sense Kotori's relief.
It was as though the tension that had continued\nsince the canopy had closed finally dissipated.
'All right, can I say something a little bit\nintrusive?'
'? ...Yeah, go ahead.'
'I like you.'
'I like you, and not as a friend, but as a girl.'
'...Maybe it's a nuisance for you, but I want you\nto know.'
Kotori stopped talking.
There was an awkward silence.
Just as I became nervous that I surprised her,
'(sniff)...(sniff)'
I realized that Kotori was crying.
'Kotori...?'
'...This isn't a dream, is it?'
'No, I'm pretty sure we're awake.'
'I, I... like you...(sniff)'
'I like you, too.'
'I like you, Aoi!'
While crying, Kotori spoke with all her might.\nHer voice carried through the inside of the\ncanopy.
I felt it not just with my ears, but with my\nentire body.
'I'm... so glad to hear that.'
'Yeah.'
I felt more relieved than happy.
'So we both feel this way.'
'Yeah, we do.'
'Which means we're dating... right?'
'Yeah, from now... until forever.'
'I see.'
'Heh...Hehehe...'
My happiness that I'd been holding in finally\nboiled over.
'Hehe...Haha...Gahahahahaha!!'
Kotori is surprised at my sudden laughter.
'Wh, what's wrong?'
But I couldn't stop. I was so happy.
'Kotori, I like you. I love youuuuu!!!'
I surrendered myself to the overflowing emotions\nand tilted the control stick.
The glider spins around while flying.
'Whoa, whoaaa!! Ahhhh!!?'
'Ahahahaha!! I'm so glad! Kotori says she likes\nme!!'
'Y, yeah, I... like you!'
Taking in Gs inside the cockpit, Kotori answers\nfrantically.
'I like you too, Kotori!'
'Eheheh...'
The glider spins and does a somersault.
Like my happiness had been transferred to the\nglider.
'Hey, this is supposed to be a test!!'
Ageha's scolding voice came through the radio\ntransceiver.
'What are you doing, piloting like that on the\nfirst flight?!!'
'I, I'm sorry. I just got a little excited...'
I panicked and leveled the plane out.
'Kotori, are you all right...?'
'Yeah... I'm just a little dizzy...'
'I know that you're happy. Anyway,\ncongratulations.'
'...Huh? Congratulations?'
'Congratulations, Aoi and Kotori!'
'Huh?... What does that mean...?'
'We heard everything that happened. It got us all\nso excited!'
'Yeah, it seems that the radio in the passenger\nseat was on the entire time!'
'What?!!'
'No way...'
'It seems there's some trouble with the radio.\nSorry we realized so late!'
'You liar! You must have realized right away!'
'But thanks to that, we were able to share your\nspecial moment with you!'
'A confession in the sky is so romantic!'
'...(blushes)'
'...(blushes)'
'I thought for sure you were letting us listen on\npurpose.'
These guys...
'Aoi, were you planning on doing that from the\nbeginning?'
'Uh... Maybe.'
I had intended to tell Kotori my feelings on\ntoday's test flight.
It was a chance for us to have some time alone,\njust the two of us.
There was no worry of being overheard by\nanyone... or so I had thought.
'Well, at least you'll have less work to do when\nyou report about the flight to me. Transmission\nout.'
The transmission cut off.
'Kotori...'
'...Yeah.'
Kotori was looking down, her face beet red.
After that, we stayed in the sky as long as we\ncould, and we took as much time as possible to\nland on the runway.
We succeeded in landing without any problems, and\nwhen we released the lock, the canopy was opened\nfrom the outside.
Ageha and the others greeted us with smiles so\nwide that they made me feel ill.
'Welcome back, you two!'
'Welcome back!'
'Hehehe, welcome back!'
'Okay, Asa and Yoru, help me get Kotori down.'
'OK!'
Kotori, who came down from the cockpit and sat in\nher wheelchair, was blushing deeply and had an\nunhappy expression on her face.
'You don't have to be so worried. We aren't going\nto make fun of you.'
'...Yeah, please don't. Right now, I'm so\nembarrassed that I could die.'
'Great job, Aoi!'
'Great job with everything!'
'...You're going to make fun of me, aren't you?'
Asa's eyes sparkled like those of a heroine from\na comic book, and a smile crept onto Yoru's\nmouth.
When I blushed, my cheek was slapped from behind.
'That was impressive!'
'Even you, An-chan?!'
'You were pretty cool!'
Being told that by An-chan made me feel bashful,\nbut also happy.
'So how was the feel of the glider?'
'Like I told you over the radio, it's a little\npitchy, but it's easy to pilot once you get used\nto it.'

'The feeling of gliding was smooth, too. The sink
rate was low, and, compared to the other model,
it seems like it will be able to stay in the air
for longer.'
'I see. I see. How about adjustments?'
'It doesn't need anything right now.'
'OK. I'll check for damage or warping. I'll also\ncheck the connections. So sorry, but could you\nsit in the cockpit?'
'OK.'
We have to check whether there was damage to the\nparts during the first flight a moment ago.
We will still fly it several more times today.
I met eyes with Kotori for just an instant, and\nthen headed toward the cockpit.
'Kotori!'
'Eh... what?'
'Congratulations!'
'Uh, ah...eheheh.'
'Ageha, I'm ready over here!'
'Okay! I'll be ride there!'
From a distance away, Kotori watched blankly as\nwe did our preparations for the next test flight.
